name: Pop Hits - Which Decade? VII Multiple Choice Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which decade did Michael Jackson sing a song to "Billie Jean"?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	"Billie Jean" was a chart topping 1983 hit in both the US and UK. This classic track was Written by Michael Jackson and produced by Quincy Jones.

questions.text: When did the Beatles buy a "Ticket to Ride"?
questions.explanation:
1960s.

	Written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney, as were most of the Beatles hits, "Ticket to Ride" was a chart topper for the 'Fab Four' in 1965.

questions.text: In which decade did Paula Abdul advise listeners to "Rush Rush"?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	"Rush Rush", from her second album, was a hit for Paula Abdul in 1991. This single stayed #1 in the US for five straight weeks.

questions.text: When did George Michael utter a "Careless Whisper"?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	George Michael topped both the US and UK charts with "Careless Whisper" in 1984. George, real name Georgios Panayiotou, produced this track which he co-wrote with Andrew Ridgley.

questions.text: In which decade did Gloria Gaynor unleash "I Will Survive" on the karaoke generation?
questions.explanation:
1970s.

	What would the girls have to sing on karaoke night if Gloria Gaynor had not released this tune in 1979. (It's OK guys, we've got "My Way".) "I Will Survive" topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text: When did Eminem introduce us to "The Real Slim Shady"?
questions.explanation:
2000s.

	Rap superstar Eminem, real name Marshall Mathers, got to #4 in the US and #1 in the UK with this year 2000 track.

questions.text: In which decade was Tommy Roe feeling a little "Dizzy"?
questions.explanation:
1960s.

	"Dizzy", released in 1969, was a chart topper in both the US and UK for Tommy Roe. Tommy, a US born singer/song writer, also had 1960s top-ten hits with "Sheila" and "The Folk Singer".

questions.text: Take That told us they were "Back for Good", but in which decade was that?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	"Back for Good" was written and co-produced by group member Gary Barlow. The song, a US #7 and UK #1, was a hit in 1995.

questions.text: In which decade did Blondie have a smash hit with "Heart of Glass"?
questions.explanation:
1970s.

	This track featured the distinctive vocal of Deborah Harry. She also co-wrote this 1979 hit which got to the top in the US and UK.

questions.text: When did Stevie Wonder sing "I Just Called to Say I Love You"?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	Stevie Wonder also wrote and produced this 1984 Motown track. "I Just Called to Say I Love You" topped the US and UK charts.
